chargeHist.descr: Possess Firearm-Adjudicated Deliquent of a Felony

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Possess Firearm-Adjudicated Deliquent of a Felony

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kimel Kequan Conley-Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kimel Kequan Conley-Johnson in court.  Attorney Michael J Steinle in court for Kimel Kequan Conley-Johnson.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea hearing.  Parties have reached an agreement for global resolution of this matter with Case 21CF3912 from Br. 19 and Case 22CM1657 from Br 15. There are no victims in this case. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

AS TO COUNT 1 AND 2 : Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, body armor, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Defendant remanded into custody pending sentencing.  Case adjourned to Branch 9 for Sentencing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, filed

Defendant Kimel Kequan Conley-Johnson in court.  Attorney Michael J Steinle in court for Kimel Kequan Conley-Johnson. No appearance by the State.

Case in Court for Scheduling conference. Discussion held off the record. Possible global resolution with Case No. 21CF3912 before Br 19 and joinder of both cases to Br. 9.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing hearing before Br. 9. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court will be down on 8/19/2022 in the am; with agreement of counsel, the Scheduling Conference is reset for 8/31/2022 at 1:30 am

Defendant Kimel Kequan Conley-Johnson in court with Attorney Michael J Steinle.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.   
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and forwarded to Judge for review.  nk

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kimel Kequan Conley-Johnson in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Defendant Kimel Kequan Conley-Johnson in custody.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
